thread.title: High School Football 10/10/15

title: High School Football 10/10/15
text:
High School Football 10/10/15 
FLORENCE 49, FOUNTAIN HILLS 0 
FLORENCE — The Gophers snapped a four-game losing streak Friday night with a 49-0 homecoming win over Fountain Hills. 
Florence quarterback Jarred Wood threw a pair of touchdown passes in the second quarter including a 61-yard strike to Kyon Cluff to give the Gophers a 22-0 lead en route to a 36-0 lead at halftime. 
Shane Mathis had two touchdown runs in the third quarter. 
Florence improved to 3-4 overall and 1-1 in Division IV/Section 5. Fountain Hills fell to 1-6, 0-2. 
— Rodney Haas, Staff Writer 
COMBS 34, COOLIDGE 17 
SAN TAN VALLEY — A 21-point second-half surge by the Combs Coyotes on Friday night was more than enough to send the Coolidge Bears to their sixth straight loss. 
The first half went about as well as Coolidge could have asked for with a Luis Grijalva field goal, a touchdown run by running back Ralph Knight on fourth down and a touchdown pass from quarterback Trenton Davis to Sivonte Jordan, giving the Bears a 17-14 lead at the midway point. 
But that was where the offense ended for Coolidge (1-6, 0-2 Division IV/Section 5) and began for Combs (4-3, 2-0). Combs running back Erick Guerra had second-half touchdowns of 51, 32 and 12 yards. 
— Robby Gal, Staff Writer 
SANTA CRUZ 14, AMERICAN LEADERSHIP 12 
QUEEN CREEK — The Dust Devils improved to 6-1 overall and 3-0 in Division V/Section 8 with Friday night’s win over the Patriots (6-1, 2-1). 
ARCADIA 31, MARICOPA 10 
MARICOPA — The Rams’ first loss of the season on Friday night dropped their record to 6-1 overall and 3-1 in Division III/Section 1. 
Arcadia improved to 5-2, 2-1. 
CANYON DEL ORO 34, POSTON BUTTE 28 
ORO VALLEY — Poston Butte fell to 0-7 on the season with Friday night’s loss at Canyon del Oro in the Broncos’ Division II/Section 3 opener. 
Canyon del Oro improved to 2-5, 1-1.
